definition: to canvas (for customers)/to solicit/to advertise/to drum up/sales pitch/to take on (a task)
old variant of 兜[dou1]
pocket/bag/to wrap up or hold in a bag/to move in a circle/to canvas or solicit/to take responsibility for/to disclose in detail/combat armor (old)
to monopolize/to seize/to take into one's arms/to embrace/to fasten (with a rope etc)/to take on (responsibility etc)/to canvass

sentences.english: They were trying to drum up new business.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在努力兜揽新生意。

sentences.english: Minicabs are not allowed to tout for hire on the streets.
sentences.chinese: 小型出租车禁止在街上兜揽生意。

sentences.english: The taxi is cruise down the street in search of passenger.
sentences.chinese: 计程车沿大街缓慢地行驶以兜揽顾客。

sentences.english: She canvassed for insurance during her spare time.
sentences.chinese: 她在业余时间里兜揽保险业务。

definition: to tout/to solicit customers
to create a disturbance/to make trouble/to harass
porter/bearer
to earn a living
(coll.) job/work
to buy and sell/to do business/to trade/to deal
to look for a bargain/to seek advantage/to try to gain at expense of others
shop assistant/shop clerk
to hang on to and serve the rich and powerful by literary hack work etc
female brothel keeper/a bawd
to purchase goods (for a company etc)
to persuade using all possible arguments (idiom); to act good cop and bad cop in turn
erhua variant of 窯姐|窑姐[yao2 jie3]
to order (sb) around/to send on an errand/to order away
see 迎來送往|迎来送往[ying2 lai2 song4 wang3]
if/supposing that
person who lives and makes a living on a boat/boatman/boat dweller
